comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Wonderful detail in the large size - you can almost smell the place - great period details of a working dock. See comments and links on www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/8160269125/ - likely to be a different day because of the ships involved, c.1902 December. The photographer must have been up a ship's mast to get this shot - there are no tall buildings or hills close by. Hence the slight tilt.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] re the 'windmill' that has our curators a bit stumped. A bit impractical for voyages but is perhaps set up to work as a pump pumping water or air...
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Yes, it struck me as unusual.   Looks like a permanent fixture on the ship.
